for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. `` It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat,'' Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

a memo saying that`` we might be missing an opportunity'' and wondering if more troops were needed. Donald Rumsfeld alleges that he later learned a CIA agent on the ground had requested just that, but adds: I never received such a request from either Tommy Franks or Tenet. And can not imagine denying it if I had. If someone thought Osama bin Laden was cornered, as later claimed, I found it surprising that Tenet had never called me to urge Tommy Franks to support their operation. Donald Rumsfeld 's explanation?`` Their recollections may be imperfect.''
